cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi NW of Ciudad del Carmen, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to meander near the southern Bay of Campeche, then turn north‐northeast on Thursday and accelerate northward across the Gulf toward the central Louisiana coast this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near Morgan City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz, Mexico (tropical-storm watch/warning area only in southern Gulf of Mexico)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: southern Bay of Campeche coast now; central U.S. Gulf Coast (mainly Louisiana–Mississippi) by late weekend
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed (Kansas City not included in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: A period of breezy conditions (25–35 mph gusts) possible as the post-tropical remnants pass, but tropical-storm-force winds are not expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (inland river port, far from Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of remnant tropical rainfall possible early next week, bringing localized river-rise concerns
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief river/flash-flood potential on the Missouri River and tributaries if bands set up over the basin
